intro: Hiraea woytkowskii, commonly known as the Woytkowski's hiraea, is a rare and lesser-known flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hiraea woytkowskii is considered a vulnerable species.
